Comments_List: I developed a higher level of comfort with speaking, reading, writing, and understanding Japanese. We learned a lot of grammar structures that are actually useful, and we learned lots of common phrases and conversational situations that frequently come up in Japan. Some elements of Japanese culture make a lot more sense after having learned about the ways the language functions.
a great introduction to basic japanese!

constant work makes for constant improvement! very well taught, and the practice conversations are fun so the class has a good time. 
It might help to have more speaking practice for homework/outside of class rather than worksheets, which are only sometimes helpful.
just because of the format of the course, it was sometimes weaker at writing & conversational speaking; language table was a good supplement for that!
If you're really dedicated to taking Japanese (whether for fun or for the sake of learning a new language) then absolutely. But you have to want it!
